title: JUST Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster
snippet: The meaning of JUST is having a basis in or conforming to fact or reason : reasonable.

title: JUST Definition & Meaning | Dictionary.com
snippet: just so, neat and tidy; carefully arranged. My mother-in-law is very fussy; everything has to be placed just so.

title: JUST | English meaning - Cambridge Dictionary
snippet: JUST definition: 1. now, very soon, or very recently: 2. a very short time ago: 3. at the present time: . Learn more.

title: Just - definition of just by The Free Dictionary
snippet: Define just. just synonyms, just pronunciation, just translation, English dictionary definition of just. adj. 1. Honorable and fair in one's dealings and actions: a just ruler.

title: just - WordReference.com Dictionary of English
snippet: just1 ( just), adj. guided by truth, reason, justice, and fairness: We hope to be just in our understanding of such difficult situations. done or made according to principle; equitable; proper: a just reply. based on right; rightful; lawful: a just claim. in keeping with truth or fact; true; correct: a just analysis. given or awarded rightly;
